tasks.task: Perform initial text region identification to locate potential handwritten areas as defined in phase_1 of the verification process.
Apply morphological analysis to examine stroke patterns, pressure variations, and character formation for each identified region.
Use comparative methodology to build character pattern databases and validate uncertain character identifications.
Apply contextual analysis including linguistic probability, semantic coherence, and historical orthographic patterns.
Examine physical evidence including ink flow, paper interaction, corrections, and bleed-through patterns.
Assign confidence levels to all transcribed elements using the established scoring criteria.
Structure the transcription preserving original document layout, line breaks, and spatial relationships.
Identify and separately document marginal annotations, corrections, or editorial marks.
Distinguish handwritten text from printed text, stamps, or mechanical marks throughout the document.
If no handwritten text meets verification criteria after all phases, respond with the not_found_response as specified.
Provide comprehensive analysis notes including writing characteristics, estimated historical period, and document type assessment.
Document primary transcription challenges and recommend follow-up actions for improved analysis where applicable.
